subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] new font released
msgSnippet: ... Here s what I found when I did a search on line: I am not sure what would cause the ’Missing OpenType data’ for an OTF, but I know that TrueType fonts
messageBody:
oliver langan wrote:
>

>
> I downloaded the Thoth archive from the files section, and am getting an
> error when I try to install the Thoth.ttf file on my Mac. The font
> fails validation, and the error indicates that it is "Missing OpenType
> Data." ThothUni.ttf on the other hand installs correctly.
>
> Has anyone else had this problem? I downloaded the file twice, and
> tried unzipping it with several different utilities. I also tried
> installing from the Thoth.ttf file in this archive:
> http://quikscript.sourceforge.net/quikscript-snapshot.tar.gz
> <http://quikscript.sourceforge.net/quikscript-snapshot.tar.gz>
> which was linked in another message. That one does /not/ fail, but it
> also does not install correctly.

Here's what I found when I did a search on line:

"I am not sure what would cause the ’Missing OpenType data’ for an OTF,
but I know that TrueType fonts which lack a ’fpgm’, ’cvt ’, or ’prep’
table will generate that in Font Book under OS X 10.4. This has been
confirmed as being a bogus error; as this condition is common in
unhinted TrueType fonts. You can avoid the error by generating TTF with
hints; or just ignore the error and install the font anyway."

In fact, I have generated my fonts without hints. If I am correct, I
think the font installer just puts the font in the right folder. If you
open up font book and pick an font, then pull down the menu that says
show font in finder (or something similar), you should find that folder.

In the meantime I'll see if I can fix the font on my end.

Paul
